titles.title: In evil long I took delight

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: In evil long I took delight, Unawed by shame or fear, Till a new object struck my sight, And stopped my wild career.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I saw One hanging on a tree, In agony and blood, Who fixed His languid eyes on me, As near His cross I stood.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Sure, never to my latest breath, Can I forget that look; It seemed to charge me with His death, Though not a word He spoke.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: My conscience felt and owned the guilt, And plunged me in despair, I saw my sins His blood had spilt, And helped to nail Him there.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Alas! I knew not what I did, But now my tears are vain; Where shall my trembling soul be hid? For I the Lord have slain.

verse.name: v6
v7
verse.lines: Thus, while His death my sin displays, In all its blackest hue, Such is the mystery of grace, It seals my pardon too.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: With pleasing grief and mournful joy, My spirit now is filled; That I should such a life destroy, Yet live by Him I killed.
